result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Apfel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 years probation consecutive to jail time in 14CF164; conditions of probation- pay child support on time and in full; $100 per month in arrears for child support for 36 months; comply with child support orders; court costs totaling $518.00; DNA sample & surcharge; AODA treatment & follow-thru 45 days after released from custody in 14CF164; absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without valid Rx; any recommended treatment
Consecutive to: Jail time in 14CF164

miscConds.notes: $518.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM    Defendant David J. Apfel in court, appearing by telephone from Prairie Du Chien Correctional.  Susan Czarnecki VenRooy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court and DE have discussion about DE's pro-se filing.
Court states that it has reviewed the DE's request for sentence adjustment, the State has objected.
Mr Apfel makes statement.  State objects to sentence adjustment.
Court finds nothing extraordinary to justify adjustment, Denies petition, not in the public interest.

Prairie Du Chen Correctional called as they noticed the DE was to have a sentence adjustment review hearing and it was set up for a phone confence at Dodge Correctional.  We set it up so the call can take place at Prairie Du Chen Correctional now phone number is in comments in calendar.
